body_html:
@rajnamitha I am using python 2.7, so cannot comment about the behaviour in python 3.5

I think there is a way to verify if QuantizedAdd op is supported by your build!
In tensorflow/core/kernels:BUILD, look for the following part.

tf_kernel_library(
name = "quantized_ops",
....)

If there is a "quantized_add_op.cc" listed in it, then I think this op is supported by your build. And there should be a file with the same name in 'core' folder.

I came to this conclusion after comparing the BUILD file of r1.1 and r1.2
However even I am facing the accuracy drop issue with the quantized model.

body:
@rajnamitha I am using python 2.7, so cannot comment about the behaviour in python 3.5

I think there is a way to verify if QuantizedAdd op is supported by your build!
In tensorflow/core/kernels:BUILD, look for the following part. 

tf_kernel_library(
    name = "quantized_ops",
....)

If there is a "quantized_add_op.cc" listed in it, then I think this op is supported by your build. And there should be a file with the same name in 'core' folder.

I came to this conclusion after comparing the BUILD file of r1.1 and r1.2
However even I am facing the accuracy drop issue with the quantized model.
